intro: Hirpicium gorterioides subsp. schinzii, commonly known as the Schinz's hirpicium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands. It produces small, bract-like leaves and has a short, upright stem. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
